timeline.message: Examples for the first version of the article

timeline.bodyText: Let's fix the warning about raw types if possible.
timeline.author: JonCook

replies.bodyText: I must have some settings not properly set because I see no warnings. Could you point me in the right direction?
replies.author: mdhtr

replies.bodyText: The warning here is - HashMap is a raw type. References to generic type HashMap<K,V> should be parameterized. It can be fixed like - new HashMap<>()
replies.author: JonCook

timeline.bodyText:
I'm not a big fan of these *Example type classes with the main method. Let's move this into a unit test using the test method names (givenX_whenY_thenZ) as mentioned in the author guidelines.
In general, we want as much coverage as possible on our new code. Putting it in a unit test is also easier for readers to run the code and also we validate that it is working as expected.
timeline.author: JonCook

replies.bodyText: @JonCook I've converted everything into unit tests, but I'm not confident that I've found good names for these tests. Using assertions is definitely better than console prints, so I am happy in that regard, however, the Eclipse formatter doesn't allow multiline strings, so the inline JSON objects look terrible.
replies.author: mdhtr

replies.bodyText:
I think the test approach is good! Could we shorten the test names a little? I think you are on the right track. e.g
givenAJsonLdObject_whenCompactIsUsedWithEmptyContext_thenItCanBeDeserializedIntoAJacksonAnnotatedJavaObject()
Could become for example (just an idea):
givenAJsonLdString_whenCompactIsUsedWithEmptyContext_thenDeserializedCorrectly()
Let's also please move the Person class into the main src tree.
Finally, I agree the inline JSON does not look good. I'm afraid we will have to fix that manually without using the formatter.
replies.author: JonCook

replies.bodyText: @JonCook is givenAJsonLdObject_whenCompactIsUsedWithEmptyContext_thenItCanBeDeserializedWithJackson() okay? Are the two other test names okay like they are?
replies.author: mdhtr

timeline.bodyText: These system.out will likely become assert statements. But if you want to print, let's use a proper logger.
timeline.author: JonCook

timeline.bodyText: As these POJO classes are already in a separate package, can we not simply call the class Person?
timeline.author: JonCook

timeline.bodyText: As these POJO classes are already in a separate package, can we not simply call the class Person?

timeline.bodyText: The same comment applies about moving to a unit test.

timeline.bodyText: There is a warning here about serial version Ids

replies.bodyText: I must have some settings not properly set because I see no warnings. Could you point me in the right direction?
replies.author: mdhtr

replies.bodyText: The warning here is - The serializable class does not declare a static final serialVersionUID field of type long. But I think we can leave this one. Don't worry.
replies.author: JonCook

timeline.message: Examples for the second version of the article

Changes based on editor review

- extract Person classes from test classes
- shorten test name of one test
- fix one warning
Format inline JSON objects by hand
